settings.subheading: Your beauty routine shouldn't be stressful. We've made sure it isn't.
settings.title1: How to Use Your Ulike IPL Device

settings.text2: air3-box
air10-box
Prep Skin
settings.text3: Use the included razor to shave any hairs longer than 2 mm (1/16 in) in the treatment area.
settings.text4: Shave a day ahead to prevent irritation and skip waxing/plucking to keep roots intact.

settings.text2: Power On
settings.text3: Press the power button to turn on the device. Wait 4 seconds for the cooling system to activate.
settings.text4: Gently cleanse and dry skin completely before treatment; avoid harsh exfoliants.

settings.text2: Select Mode
settings.text15: Patch test a small area to check you skin sensitivity.
settings.text3: Fast Mode
settings.text4: Flashes twice every second for quick maintenance on larger areas.
settings.text7: Provides balanced power for a gentler experience. The go-to mode for most body parts.
settings.text10: Delivers more intense pulses to tackle thick, dark hair.
settings.text13: Delivers a 4-pulse flash every second at the highest intensity. Best for particularly stubborn hair.

settings.text2: Start Treatment
settings.text3: Hold the device flush against your skin at a 90° angle and press the button to activate the light pulse. Move the device in a slow, sweeping motion to treat each area evenly.
settings.text4: Flash an area no more than 3 times in a single session to avoid irritation.

settings.text2: Prep Skin
settings.text3: Use the included razor to shave any hairs longer than 2 mm (1/16 in) in the treatment area.
settings.text4: Shave a day ahead to prevent irritation and skip waxing/plucking to keep roots intact.

settings.text2: Power On
settings.text3: Press the power button to turn on the device. Wait 8 seconds for the cooling system to activate.
settings.text4: Gently cleanse and dry skin completely before treatment; avoid harsh exfoliants.

settings.text2: Select Mode
settings.text15: Patch test a small area to check you skin sensitivity.
settings.text3: Soft Mode
settings.text4: Reduces treatment time while maintaining effectiveness. Perfect for larger areas and touch-ups.
settings.text7: Perfectly balances power and flash speed to gently remove fine to normal hair on most body parts.
settings.text10: Delivers high-intensity pulses to tackle thick, stubborn hair.

settings.text2: Start Treatment
settings.text3: Hold the device flush against your skin at a 90° angle and press the button to activate the light pulse. Move the device in a slow, sweeping motion to treat each area evenly.
settings.text4: Flash an area no more than 3 times in a single session to avoid irritation.

settings.text2: During the first few weeks, hair starts shedding, and density decreases by up to 96%. Growth along the hairline slows down, while central areas may take longer to respond.
settings.text3: Consistent use ensures all hairs are treated as they cycle through different growth phases.

settings.text2: As hair reduction progresses, most treated hair falls out, although some stubborn hairs and those still in the resting phase may remain during this stage.
settings.text3: Regular sessions help target lingering strands and hairs in the resting phase.

settings.text2: Near the final stages, nearly all hair stops growing, with up to 99.99% hair reduction achieved. You may see minor regrowth, but it’s hardly noticeable.
settings.text3: Treat any occasional regrowth that occurs for a smooth finish.

settings.text2: With consistent maintenance, your skin stays smooth long-term, and only occasional touch-ups should be necessary to remove periodic regrowth.
settings.text3: Regular touch-ups preserve results and prevent any new hair from growing back.

settings.text2: Hair begins to shed (up to 93% hair density reduction). Growth along the hairline slows, while stubborn areas around joints and central regions remain active.
settings.text3: Consistent use ensures all hairs are treated as they cycle through different phases.

settings.text2: As treatment continues, most hair enters the shedding phase, but stubborn hairs and hairs entering the active growth phase may persist during this stage.
settings.text3: Regular sessions help target these lingering strands and hairs in the resting phase.

settings.text2: Very few hairs remain and growth has significantly reduced by up to 99.99%. You see small patches of occasional hair growth, but they’re barely noticeable.
settings.text3: Continue treating any remaining hair for a smooth, lasting finish.

settings.text2: At this stage, your skin should stay hair-free for extended periods, and only occasional touch-ups are necessary to remove periodic regrowth.
settings.text3: Occasional touch-ups maintain smoothness and prevent regrowth.

settings.text1: Start at the lowest setting on a small area, flashing 1–3 times. Gradually increase the intensity on different spots until reaching the highest setting. If no adverse reactions occur within 24 hours, proceed with your full treatment. Stop use if discomfort arises.

Consistent use ensures the best long-term results. Stick to your schedule, and you’ll typically begin seeing results in 1–4 weeks, and smooth, hair-free skin in about 4 months. Allow 48–72 hours between treatments to prevent irritation and ensure safe, effective results.
Start with the lowest setting, especially if you have sensitive skin. Gradually increase as your skin adjusts to minimize discomfort and maximize effectiveness.
Avoid sun exposure after treatment and apply SPF 30+ to prevent irritation or pigmentation changes. Stay hydrated by drinking water and moisturize daily for better IPL results.
Never point the device at your eyes, and wear the protective eyewear included with Ulike devices.

settings.title: Where can IPL be used?
settings.text1: Use only on areas below the cheekbones. Shaded zones highlight typical areas of concern.
settings.text2: Do NOT use on genitals, nipples, tattoos, scars, overly tanned skin, moles, or if pregnant/nursing.
Can this be used on tattooed areas?
settings.text3: "I've got tattoos that I cherish. Will IPL damage my ink?"
settings.text9: Avoid treating tattooed areas for two reasons. First, it can cause heat buildup and discomfort (since IPL targets pigment). Second, the light energy can destabilize tattoo ink, potentially causing the tattoo to fade or even change color. If you have tattoos, avoid treating the tattooed area itself, but surrounding skin is usually safe for treatment.

settings.text2: Can this be used on darker skin?
settings.text3: "I have naturally olive skin, but I tan pretty dark. Can I still use IPL?"
settings.text9: IPL works best when there’s a strong contrast between hair and skin tone. Darker skin absorbs more light, which increases the risk of burns or hyperpigmentation. If your skin tone falls within the lower range of the Fitzpatrick scale (I–IV), IPL may be suitable, but always do a patch test first. But if you have a darker skin tone, consider other options like professional ND:YAG lasers or electrolysis.

settings.text2: Does it work on blonde hair?
settings.text3: "My hair is naturally blonde. Will IPL still work?"
settings.text9: IPL targets melanin (pigment) in the hair follicle. Darker hair absorbs the light energy effectively, but very light hair — such as blonde, gray, white, or red — may not have enough pigment for effective results. If your hair has a darker root, you may still see some improvement.

settings.text2: Do I always need to shave before using IPL?
settings.text3: "Do I have to shave every time before using IPL? I thought IPL was supposed to eliminate the need to shave..."
settings.text9: Yes, shaving is essential before IPL treatment if the hair's longer than 2 mm. Shaving a day before a session removes hair at the surface while leaving the root intact, allowing the light to reach the follicle effectively. Don't wax or pluck, as these remove the hair from the root, making IPL ineffective. While this may be a step you'd prefer to avoid, in the long-run, IPL reduces hair growth, and thus reduces the need to shave.

settings.text2: How many times should I flash the same area?
settings.text3: "Should I go over the same spot multiple times during a session?"
settings.text9: For the best results, flash each area three times per session. This ensures even coverage and maximizes effectiveness. Avoid exceeding three flashes per spot, as it won’t improve results and may cause irritation.

settings.text2: Does IPL hair removal hurt?
settings.text3: "I'm pretty sensitive to pain. Is IPL painful?"
settings.text9: Ulike’s IPL devices feature Sapphire Ice Cooling Technology, making treatments very comfortable and the sensation highly tolerable. Most users describe a mild warmth or tingling sensation, but nothing uncomfortable.

settings.text2: Can I tan before or after using IPL?
settings.text3: "I love tanning. How does that affect IPL treatments?"
settings.text9: Wait at least two weeks before using IPL after tanning, and one month if you have a sunburn to avoid irritation. You should avoid tanning during a treatment cycle, as darker skin absorbs more light, increasing the risk of burns. If you plan to tan after IPL, wait 48 hours and always use a broad-spectrum SPF 30+ for protection and to prevent premature aging. For a safer alternative, opt for self-tanning lotions or sprays instead of sun exposure.

settings.text2: Can I use deodorant after IPL?
settings.text3: "Can I apply deodorant right after treating my armpits?"
settings.text9: It’s best to wait a few hours before using deodorant. IPL can make the skin more sensitive, and applying deodorant immediately may cause irritation.

settings.text2: Can I use lotion after IPL?
settings.text3: "Can I apply my favorite moisturizer after a session?"
settings.text9: Moisturizing with lotion is great, but I recommend using a gentle, fragrance-free lotion or aloe vera gel to soothe the skin. Avoid products with alcohol, retinoids, or harsh chemicals.

settings.text2: Is Ulike IPL safe to use?
settings.text3: "Is IPL really safe for home use?"
settings.text9: Yes, IPL is a well-researched, clinically tested hair removal method. Ulike IPL devices are FDA-cleared and certified by the FCC, UKCA, CE, and RoHS for safe at-home use. Plus, all UV rays are filtered to protect your skin.

settings.text2: Can pregnant women use IPL?
settings.text3: "Can I use IPL while pregnant or breastfeeding?"
settings.text9: There’s no conclusive evidence that IPL affects pregnancy or breastfeeding, but to be cautious, I do not recommend using IPL during these periods.

settings.text2: Does IPL cause cancer?
settings.text3: "Can IPL increase my risk of cancer?"
settings.text9: No, IPL does not cause cancer. It’s a safe, non-invasive technology that only affects the hair follicle. Unlike UV rays, IPL does not damage DNA or increase cancer risk.

settings.text2: Can I travel with my IPL device, or are there lithium battery restrictions?
settings.text3: "Can I take my IPL handset on a plane?"
settings.text9: Yes! Ulike IPL handsets are dual voltage (100V–240V) and work worldwide. You may need a plug adapter depending on your destination.

settings.text2: What is the voltage of the Ulike IPL handset?
settings.text3: "How many volts is the device?"
settings.text9: Ulike IPL handsets operate at 100V–240V, making them compatible with international outlets.

settings.text2: How many flashes does the device have? Can the head be replaced?
settings.text3: "How long does the device last? Will I need to replace its parts?"
settings.text9: Ulike IPL devices come with 300,000 flashes, which last over five years with regular use. There’s no need for replacements or refills. Wipe the head with a clean, dry cloth after every use for proper maintenance.
